meanings.definition: A formal or ceremonial act or procedure
meanings.sent1: The graduation rite was a special event for all students.
meanings.sent2: The wedding rite included exchanging vows and rings.
meanings.sent3: During the rite, the principal accidentally tripped on the stage.
meanings.sent4: The rite of passage symbolized the transition to adulthood.
meanings.sent5: The ancient rite was performed with great precision and care.

meanings.definition: A religious or solemn ceremony or ritual
meanings.sent1: The funeral rite was a somber occasion for all attendees.
meanings.sent2: The priest conducted the baptism rite in the church.
meanings.sent3: In the rite, the choir unexpectedly started singing a popular song.
meanings.sent4: The sacred rite connected the community to their spiritual beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The traditional rite was passed down through generations with reverence.

meanings.sent1: The holiday rite of decorating the tree brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent2: The daily rite of morning coffee helped start the day right.
meanings.sent3: As part of the rite, everyone wore silly hats to work on Fridays.
meanings.sent4: The cultural rite of sharing a meal together strengthened bonds.
meanings.sent5: The annual rite of spring cleaning made the house feel fresh and new.
